intro: Hesperomeles weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white to pinkish flowers that bloom during the dry season. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that is edible and contains several seeds. Hesperomeles weberbaueri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to high-altitude environments.
